intro: Bellia aurata, commonly known as golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Bellia aurata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
